keyword: calories in extra virgin olive oil
title: Calories in Extra Virgin Olive Oil
meta_description: Discover calories in extra virgin olive oil per tablespoon, including fat breakdown, zero carbs, and healthy fat benefits for your diet.
h1: Calories in Extra Virgin Olive Oil
assumptions: Pure extra virgin olive oil; 1 tablespoon ≈ 13.5 g; no additives or infusions.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies slightly by brand, harvest, and processing; values are standard averages. Consult labels for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One tablespoon of extra virgin olive oil contains 119 kcal, primarily from healthy monounsaturated fats.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: In salad dressing with 1 tbsp balsamic vinegar (adds ~14 kcal)

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 tablespoon of extra virgin olive oil?
Is extra virgin olive oil high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, 13.5 g total fat per tablespoon, mostly healthy monounsaturated fats.

faqs.q: Does extra virgin olive oil have carbs or protein?
faqs.a: No carbs, fiber, sugars, or protein—pure fat source.

faqs.q: What's the difference in calories between extra virgin and regular olive oil?
How many calories in 100 ml of extra virgin olive oil?
faqs.a: About 884 kcal, since 1 tbsp is ~15 ml.
